Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Magnetic Seed Localization for Index Node Removal in Stage III Melanoma

Trial_Design.evidence: 12 patients with resectable stage III melanoma and measurable lymph node metastasis were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: 12 patients with resectable stage III melanoma and measurable lymph node metastasis

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to one of three ipilimumab plus nivolumab combination schemes

Objective.evidence: This pilot study assessed the feasibility and reliability of magnetic seed localization

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the congruence of therapeutic response between the index node and the total lymph node basin

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and allocation concealment methods were not specified

Number_Randomised.evidence: 12 patients with resectable stage III melanoma

Number_Analysed.evidence: All 12 magnetic seeds were successfully detected and removed

Result_Outcome.evidence: The index node response was congruent with the total basin response in all cases

Harms.evidence: No adverse events related to the magnetic seed localization were reported
